acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 24 hours EC50=0.94mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral value) of 44.9mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 44.9mg/kg and 520mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 1 and bio-accumulation was low (BCF=69 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since it was a metallic compound and the underwater action was unknown, it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (1999).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is (the auto-ignition temperature: 279degC(ICSC, 1999))

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of malformation in rat fetuses, described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002), though no data are available on maternal toxicity.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)): "Severe irritant" (though the length of recovery period is not provided). Also based on the description of human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)): "Dibutyl tin compounds generally cases skin and eye irritation."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)): "mild irritant," though results are not those of 4-hour application. Also based on the following descriptions of human health effects: "Dibutyl tin oxide compounds generally causes skin and eye irritation," "A single application of the substance to the backs of hands of 5 human volunteers produced no skin irritation," "The workers of two plants A (n=25) and B (n=56), who have been occupationally exposed to dibutyl tin oxide, metal tin, dibutyl tin iodine and dibutyl tin dichloride throughout the manufacturing process of dibutyl tin lauric acid, have been reported to exhibit skin reactions including irritation, eruption and formation of blisters" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)). The substance is thus considered to produce none to slight irritation, and classified into Category 3 from the viewpoint of safety.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "slight changes in the liver and effects on the renal tubules" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-67 (2002)), "May affect the liver and cause liver damage" (ICSC, 1994). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (liver, kidneys).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
